value: Design for a Woven Motif of the "Fabrique de St. Ruf," Unfinished

label: Description
value: An eagle standing on top of a circular medallion holds a laurel bough in the beak.

label: Physical description
value: Incised lines, brush and white gouache on glazed tracing paper pasted on paper

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, New York, NY; 1914: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Design for a Woven Horizontal Border of the "Fabrique de St. Ruf," Unfinished

label: Description
value: The right part is shown. An eagle with a laurel bough stands on top of a circular medallion with the monogram J[osephine] N[apoleon]. Which is supported by a shaft over the center of the rinceaux from which a fantastical plant rises. Framed at the bottom and at right by a waved line. A star is shown over each wave top, in the hollows is a calyx over a lace panel and a bee.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and white gouache on glazed tracing paper pasted on paper

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, New York, NY; 1914: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Design for a Woven Horizontal Border of the "Fabrique de St. Ruf," Unfinished

label: Description
value: A somewhat simplified variation of the design 1914-21-102. The left part is shown. The rinceaux are shortened, the plant simplified. A horizontally disposed plant candelabrum and an acorn rosette are shown beside the rinceau.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and white gouache on glazed tracing paper pasted on paper

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, New York, NY; 1914: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Design for a Woven Horizontal Border of the "Fabrique de St. Ruf"

label: Description
value: Somewhat more than the right half is shown. An eagle, similar to -102, stands on top of the medallion which does not show the monogram. Rinceaux start from its bottom; plants rise from the rinceaux. Scalloped framing at the bottom and at right, showing a peacock feather leave in each hollow.
